intro: Bradleia moluccana, commonly known as the Moluccan bradleia, is a member of the Acanthaceae family. It is a flowering plant native to the Moluccas and other parts of Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Bradleia moluccana thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils.
